summary.text_en: Tesla invented alternating current system! His AC motor and transformer designs enabled long-distance power transmission. He won 'War of Currents' against Edison, AC lit up entire world. He also invented radio, remote control, holding hundreds of patents.
key_points_en: Invented AC motor and polyphase AC system
Invented Tesla coil and wireless power transmission

story.text_en: In 1884, 28-year-old Tesla arrived in New York with 4 cents and recommendation letter, working for Edison. Edison promised $50,000 to improve DC generators, but after completion said it was 'American humor' and refused payment. Tesla quit angrily, began developing AC system. At 1893 Chicago World's Fair, Tesla's AC lit entire venue, shocking the world!

fun_facts.text_en: He could completely construct and test machines in his mind, no drawings or models needed!
He fell in love with white pigeon, saying: 'I loved that pigeon as a man loves a woman.'
He had OCD, repeated everything 3 times, only stayed in room numbers divisible by 3.
He claimed to sleep only 2 hours nightly, spending rest working and thinking.

experiment.description_en: Tesla demonstrated his coil device in lab, generating millions of volts. Lightning jumped through air, bulbs lit without wires. He even passed current through his own body, lighting bulb in hand - audience amazed! This showed magical properties of high-frequency AC and wireless power transmission possibilities.
experiment.why_en: Skin effect of high-frequency AC makes current flow only on body surface, not harming internal organs. Electromagnetic waves can transmit energy through space.

simple_explanation.text_en: Imagine current as water flow. Edison's DC like one-way river, only usable short distance. Tesla's AC like waves, oscillating back and forth. Waves travel far, can easily change 'wave height' (voltage) with transformers. Like turning small ripples into big waves, or big waves into ripples. That's why AC can travel from power plant to your home!

impact.text_en: Tesla's AC system completely changed the world! Today 99% of global electricity is AC. His inventions enabled long-distance power transmission, making electrification possible. He held over 300 patents in electricity, radio, remote control, radar fields. Though he died in poverty, his legacy illuminates entire modern civilization.

influenced_by.contribution_en: Electromagnetic induction law inspired AC principles
Electromagnetic theory provided foundation for wireless transmission

influenced.contribution_en: Modern power systems fully adopted AC

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Tesla based on Faraday's electromagnetic induction and Maxwell's electromagnetic theory, invented practical AC system. Westinghouse bought his patents and promoted them, ultimately defeating Edison's DC. Marconi developed wireless communication based on Tesla's radio research. Today's power systems and wireless charging all originate from Tesla's genius concepts.

quiz.question_en: What's the biggest advantage of Tesla's AC over Edison's DC?
quiz.explanation_en: AC's biggest advantage is easily changing voltage through transformers. High voltage reduces transmission loss, enabling long-distance delivery; then step down for user end. DC difficult to transform voltage, only usable short distance. This is key reason AC won 'War of Currents'.
